import React from 'react' import Sidebar from '../../components/sidebar/Sidebar' import Navsection from '../../components/navbar/Navsection' import './chapter1.scss' import { useNavigate } from "react-router-dom" const Chapter1 = () => { // ---------------- const navigate = useNavigate(); const transfer = (txt) => { if (txt.includes(":)")) { setTimeout(() => navigate('/'), 500); } } const submit = (e) => { e.preventDefault(); const code = document.getElementById("input").value; const data = { code: code }; fetch('/code', { method: 'POST', headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' }, body: JSON.stringify(data) }) .then(res => res.text()) .then(txt => alert(txt)) .then(txt => transfer(txt)) } return (

Chapter 1 Variables

What is Variable?

A variable is a box contains a piece of data information with a box name which makes it much easier to remember the address in store. Variables are stored in memory (store) and can be changed as the program runs (hence the name)

Variables have a type :

which tells us which type of information it stores Before you can use a variable to store information we must first declare it

The advantages of Java:

  • Java works on all kinds of platforms (Windows, Mac, Linux, Raspberry Pi, etc.)
  • It is one of the most used programming languages among the developers
  • Compared with other languages, it is easier to learn and simpler to use
  • It is open-source and free
  • It is secure, fast and strong
  • It has a large community support
  • Java is an object-oriented language which show the program structure clearly and support the code to be reused, lowering costs

Exercise:

Please try to output this "Hello A Java Tutor!" by using the basic Syntax (System.out.println())
